Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good morning, can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm from Techstar about a new phone system for you. I was wondering if I could talk to Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, he's not in right now.

Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: Really? He's never around when I come by.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They have new phone systems now that can ring directly to a salesman, or someone presses star and they go to accounting, basically 95% of my job. But I'd like to see a machine that puts out candy for everyone. [realizing] Vending machine.

Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: How about I make an appointment to come back? That way, I know he'll be here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That is a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [while leafing through Michael's appointment book and seeing nothing but free time] Um, oh boy, let's see, he's really...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [approaching Reception] Michael Scott, manager. Hi, how are ya?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There he is!

Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: Oh, hi! Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you, yeah. Whew! I can assure you we don't need a new system though. Happy with ours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [coming out from his office] Hello, may I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jimbo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [impersonating Fonzie] Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [running from his desk] Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim, Pam, Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Phone Salesman
Quote.Text: Ok. I'm, uh, I'll be going.

Quote.Speaker: Jim, Pam, Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That was funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was funny. Let's go do it to somebody else. Ayyyy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, look at that. Cupids and hearts. Really shoving our faces in it this year. You doin OK, bud?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I miss Stacy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I hear ya. It's been four months since I was with Holly, and she was way hotter then Stacy. So if you think you're hurting...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can't even imagine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is our first and only Valentine's Day as fiances.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're only engaged once. Well present company excluded, but.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really, Jim? On Cupid's birthday?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Jim leans in for a kiss but Pam turns away] She's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So, I received my first Valentine from a secret admirer. [Kelly opens the envelope] Roses are red, violets are blue, it's time for your dental cleaning, and maybe a check-up too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow look at those. How nice for you. Up there, front and center, beautiful. I think they would look better right here. [Michael takes the flowers from Pam's desk and puts them on the ground off to the side] They're very pretty and I wouldn't want them to fall. [Kevin groans]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just about everyone in this office is single right now. Including me. And everyone is experiencing an incredible amount of emotional pain. Especially me, because of my great capacity for emotion, and it is my first Valentine's Day since Holly, so I think that I am well qualified to understand that these people need to be protected from having love shoved into their faces.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, really, they're back?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't see them when they're on the floor

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: They're for her to look at, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I have a word with you, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, let's have a word.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, um, Jim. Today is a very difficult day for a lot of people in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. And the sexy looks between you and Pam, the general sexiness, the flowers, it's creating a bit of a hostile work environment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I understand that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So sexy it becomes hostile.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, I actually thought we were keeping it pretty low-key.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, if you guys insist on having your own private little love fest-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: -that none of us can be a part of-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can't be a part of our relationship, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [gesturing Pam to be quiet] -then, we, are gonna have our own private Valentine's Day party.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That sounds fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So suck it. Hey everybody, I just invited Jim to suck it, and I am cordially inviting all of you to a special convention, a lonely heart's convention, this afternoon. Singles only.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, deal with it Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So we may not have someone in our lives that we love, but we do have each other.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Having trouble finding a vein?

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: Yup, a little.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How about now? [Dwight untenses his arm]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I train my major blood vessels to retract into my body on command. Also, I can retract my penis up into itself. [pauses, then nods signaling that he performed the feat]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am about to give blood. The gift of everlasting life, the transfer of my bodily fluids, oh wow, that's a big needle, that --

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: You're gonna need to lie down right over here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Hi, I cant talk right now. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Whew, I'm really nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Yeah, when I get nervous I sort of clam up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well, that's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Whew, it's better for me just to be quiet, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, can I point something out to you?

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're actually talking a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Sorry, it's the other thing I do when I get really nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: Alright, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God. [Michael clears his throat]

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: Just relax.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup, I'm good, whew. Wow, I feel like a human juicebox. [Blood Girl laughs] Hawaiian blood punch.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Oh, that's gross.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Type O-Ocean Spray.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: God, stop. Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, why don't you guys come have lunch with Bob and me? We'll take all afternoon. [whispering] Michael is terrified of bob.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have a lot of work to do this afternoon. Those mines aren't gonna sweep themselves.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yick.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I looked at the bag.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Ew.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I looked straight at the bag.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: That's not good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could you distract me for a second, just talk about things that don't have blood in them?

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Well, ok... bags! [Michael is taken aback] Alright, that was bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was mean.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Um, a hat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A hat.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: A hat with no blood in it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is full of soup.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: You're cute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: You're done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, already.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Ah, we did it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whew, wow I was so nervous about this I don't think I ate for three days. [Michael passes out]

Quote.Speaker: Blood Girl
Quote.Text: Is he OK?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [ccming to] Oh my God, how long was I out? [Michael looks over where Blood Girl was and sees Hank]

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me, waitress, where did the lady go?

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: Oh. She left.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Oh, wait a second, wait a second, that's hers. This is hers, she left her glove. I need her name if I'm gonna return her glove.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: I'm sorry sir we can't give out that information. [Michael sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [seeing Kelly tear a paper heart in half] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Decorating.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'll help. [Meredith tears the wings off of a Cupid] Now it's just a stupid baby.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It is so nice to go out with another couple.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Anything to get out of that office.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I know

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: I honestly don't know how you can work with that jackass, that other jackass, and that new jackass.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He's talking about Michael, Dwight, and Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, I understood.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well here we all are. Alone but together. No flowers for us. [in a Mexican accent] Relationships, we don't need no stinking relationships. I think we should all go around and tell our worst relationship story, and then get past it, just blow through it, yeah? Kelly, what about Ryan? He treated you pretty terribly, yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, his heart was in the right place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, but now his heart is in Thailand along with the rest of his body having random sex. [Kelly looks hurt] Okay, sorry, let's, who else? Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, I'm sure there's something you need to get off your chest.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you wanna just, anything? Are you sure? I'm sure whatever you did it wasn't your fault. OK well, who else?

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Everyone here who's bowled a 280 please raise your hand. [Bob does so]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way, a 280?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, that's impressive.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay. Now everyone here who's bowled under 70 raise their hand.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yikes.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Come on, Bob. Raise your hand. [Bob does so reluctantly]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Bob, no. No!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: One time. You love bringing up that one time, don't you?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes I do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim uses a 6 pound ball.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is a lie, that is a lie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, he bowled 5 frames with this pink sparkly thing until a little girl had to ask for her ball back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But! That girl must've had monstrous hands because the holes fit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, you just have little dainty fingers.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. You can always model ladies' jewelry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nobody asked, Bob!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do you risk telling him how you feel? Do you say something that you can barely admit to yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh God, what did you do? I mean, not that I approve of any of it but...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was stupid, I told him.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Was he in to you in like a gay way?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Moron, if he was there wouldn't be a story.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He told me he wasn't gay. [everyone groans]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really sad.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm not done yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: A week later a friend of mine calls me up, and he says "I just saw him in a gay bar in Kansas City." [everybody groans except for Michael who looks pleasantly surprised]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well then it's a happy ending, because he was gay. You should call him!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My worst breakup was actually two breakups. Two different men. I was in love with both of them and when things went bad they had a duel over me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, Dwight and Andy. We were here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, this was years ago when I was living in Ohio. John Mark and John David.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, you had two sets of different men actually duel over you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I guess I have. Huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright who's next? Where's Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He's on one of his honeymoons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He made non-refundable deposits on his honeymoons, so he's just knocking them off one at a time. I think today he's hot air ballooning and later he's got a couple's massage.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My worst breakup was with Stacy. It was a Sunday morning, we were reading the paper, and I said "Oh my God, I think the Eagles could clinch the NFC East!" and she said that we're done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what guys? I don't think we need to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're right. OK everyone, back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I mean have this kind of party. I look around and I see all these beautiful people who are alone on Valentine's, and I think that there are other single people out there too. We just need to find them. There's a girl out there for all of us maybe even in this office park. There has to be a way to get all these lonely people together.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A net? a giant net?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Not a giant net.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you have in mind?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was thinking maybe like a mixer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh God, that's a terrible idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Old fashioned meet market --

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: -- I don't think it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Lonely people mixing with one another? Breeding? Creating an even lonelier generation? Ha, you're not allowing natural selection to do its work. Pssh. You're like the guy who invented the seat belt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These people need love and I am going to get it for them Who cares if we sell a little bit less paper today? A great boss cares more about the happiness of his employees then anything else. I am going to be cupid, and I am going to shoot my sparrow at unsuspecting victims, and they are going to get hit and say "I'm in love I was hit by cupid's sparrow." Funny little bird, but he gets the job done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. No movement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, still early.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eh, its not that early.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] So how you holding up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm ok. Feel a little lopsided because of all the blood they took out of my right side.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, I meant about being single today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Meh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meh, exactly. Eh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. [two women, a blonde and a redhead, enter the office. Michael and Dwight walk towards them and Dwight extends his hand to the redhead]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight K. Schrute. Why don't you introduce me to your little friend? [Dwight immediately breaks the handshake with the redhead and turns to the blonde] Hi, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Babe alert! [to the redhead] Hello, I'm Michael Scott, welcome to our little shindig.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Oh, hi! I'm Lynn.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lynn, follow me, come on in. For you we have one of our top people Kevin Malone. Kevin, come out here show your beautiful self.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [after a short pause] So run with the ball! Run with it, Kev. [after another pause] Where you from?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm from here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, OK. Well, he only gets better.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can untie any knot. I'm serious. Name a knot, any knot. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Blonde
Quote.Text: I- I- believe you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You shouldn't believe everything you hear. In fact, there are many knots that I cannot untie. So where does a woman as charming as yourself find herself employed on a day such as today.

Quote.Speaker: Blonde
Quote.Text: Um, I work at a place that does catalogs for community colleges and small businesses.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You must use a lot of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Blonde
Quote.Text: Oh God tons of it .

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's the rule about eating when people are in the bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think if you ordered hot food you're allowed to eat.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, damn. [Pam looks down at her salad] They've been in there for like ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look at that. Bob ordered hot food.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. And I think they gave him too many fries.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should help him out. [Jim and Pam each take a French fry, eat it, and then look toward the bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: At the Circle Drive-In they show old movies. It's really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: That does sound cool.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I used to go there with my fiance [Lynn is taken aback]. Before she left me [Lynn shows pity]. No, I mean, before I left her [Lynn looks confused]. She left me. [Kevin walks away dejected]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think I blew it. It all happened so fast. So... fast.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, Eric. You mentioned before that you are in tool and dye repair.

Quote.Speaker: Eric
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meredith recently had a total hysterectomy, so that's sort of a repair. Alright, I'll let you guys talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's going very well. People are mixing, a lot of hope. Cause that's what you hate to see, when hope gets crushed. [Michael suddenly turns to look at the open entrance door] Sorry, thought I heard somebody coming in. Um, so [looking at his watch] it's not too late.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...and the kind of discounts we're talking about are not... hold on - Michael, Why do you keep looking at the front door?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No reason.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is somebody after you?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why do you always go to that? Has anyone ever been after anyone in this office?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, it just takes one!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody's after me, I just, I met a woman when I was giving blood and I thought she might come by.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You met a woman when you were giving blood? That is so romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not a big deal really, I just, you know met somebody, we hardly talked, I picked up her glove so I was hoping I could give it back to her.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, that makes it even more romantic. This is like a modern day Enchanted, it's like a fairy tale.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: She could be your soul mate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, not likely. 3 billion woman on the planet, most of them live in Asia so the numbers just don't add up.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's possible.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She could be.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Believe me its nothing. I hardly even talked to her we just, we were lying there next to each other, I think our blood bags touched.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Aww. [Michael grins sheepishly]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here they come.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looking up from her pilfering of Bob's food] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, just kidding. Seriously though, that's enough.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you should cover it with the broccoli.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh great, I have to cover?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you think they dined and dashed?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well they didn't dine so, yeah, maybe they just dashed.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought we were having a nice time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We were.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [emerging from the Men's room] Empty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [exiting the Ladies' room] Mine too. [Pam and Jim notice the Handicapped stall and walk towards it. Putting their ears to the door they hear Mr. and Mrs. Vance being intimate]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh boy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Girl
Quote.Text: Is this the party? [everyone turns to Michael wanting to know if this is Blood Girl]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah. [everyone groans and Girl turns around and walks away.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: OK then.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So...

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Where were we?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [out of breath] Bowling.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep, that, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: You didn't eat much there Jimbo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh initially I did.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Want some meat?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh sure, a little piece. Ooh, no mushroom though.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Forgot.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, thank you. [As Phyllis enjoys Bob's meat, Jim and Pam look knowingly into the camera]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm sorry we did not have a chance to talk more. I get very nervous talking to pretty girls. Seriously, feel how sweaty my hand is.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: That's really sweaty.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you on email?

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. [gives Kevin her card]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cool. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Bye, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Good Valentine's.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So basically, the greater volume you decide to buy in, the greater discount we can give you.

Quote.Speaker: Blonde
Quote.Text: OK. [Blonde stands up to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Blonde
Quote.Text: Look, I'm gonna go...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh-oh-oh before you go, I'd just love to get a firm commitment on this. You know maybe sign-

Quote.Speaker: Blonde
Quote.Text: Look, we already have a paper supplier.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK. Well, thanks for wasting my time tonight, idiot. God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you don't deserve her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, if anybody wants to go...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We can stay a little longer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? [everybody signifies their agreement, and Kelly gives Michael a piece of cake] Oh, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Michael, it's time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, you guys, you guys can get out I'm gonna soldier on a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Come on, we'll all go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [after some encouragement] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Four months ago, I dated a woman named Holly and, um, this is actually the first time that I've even considered getting back into that arena again. You know what, sometimes it's not about whether Cinderella gets her slipper back, but it's about the fact that the prince even picked up the slipper at all. There's a lot of princesses out there. You know, they have all different sizes and shapes of feet and hands so I think, I think my odds are pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Pardon me, may I have a chocolate chip cookie? I gave blood earlier and I'm still feeling woozy.

Quote.Speaker: Blood Drive Worker
Quote.Text: Of course. [noticing Stanley's arm] That's weird. You got a cotton ball and tape and we've been using Band-Aids.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [backing out of the bloodmobile] I, uh-oh I feel so woozy I just [to Phyllis] Band-Aids.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Damn.
